content: Sanders may be idolised, but that alone is a huge part of the American problem. Why do we adore or hate political identities? If the political system is in need of being grounded that has to start from the bottom up. If Sanders had been elected he would have been throttled and his ability to deliver anything meaningful stifled. Within a year he would have become a pariah amongst progressives, for failing to deliver, and social media would be satirising him all over the place. (I say that whilst backing his essential messages.)
